intro: Fagraea gardenioides subsp. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean fagraea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into woody, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
